New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest pitcher in Angels history to win his major league debut
Key Match Events: Rendon singled to left, Ward scored and Neto scored
Rojas hit sacrifice fly to right, Rojas scored
Post-Match Reflections: Caden Dana became the youngest pitcher in Angels history to win his major league debut as Los Angeles rallied for a 3-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners on Sunday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Angel Stadium in Anaheim, California
The Mariners and Angels are currently tied 2-2 in the regular season series
Others: Bryce Miller pitched 4.2 innings for the Mariners, allowing 4 hits and 3 earned runs
Caden Dana pitched 6 innings for the Angels, allowing 2 hits and 2 earned runs
